it.polimi.ingsw.dinapolidinardo.server.socket

Class SocketServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • it.polimi.ingsw.dinapolidinardo.server.socket.SocketServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SocketServer
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class that manages the incoming socket connections till game doesn't start and assigns them to different socket handlers.

    The socket handlers will be used by the Game Controller since the start of the game

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Accepts incoming Socket connections and creates a Socket Handler thread for each one.

        All the Socket Handlers run concurrently and are submitted to an ExecutorService

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of problems with SocketServer

      • askForNames

        public void askForNames()
        Gets from main server the list of the existing names and ask to every Socket Handler a name. Asks again every time name chosen has already been taken, updating the list of existing names in case has been modified by other threads

      • endListening

        public void endListening()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Stops accepting connections and closes all the generated Socket Handlers. Method is called at the end of a game.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if can't close the ServerSocket

      • stopAcceptingOthersPlayers

        public void stopAcceptingOthersPlayers()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Stops accepting connections but keeps alive current handlers
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if can't close the ServerSocket

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
